data.text: A charming restaurant owned by an adorable couple.  Fabulous dinner with friends.  Lovely decor and great chef!
data.title: Do not miss if you enjoy Greek food!

data.text: One of the best restaurants I have tried all over the world. Incredible Greek cuisine with a gentle, sophisticated French touch! I cannot wait to return next month to Paris because of this incredible locale with a cozy atmosphere, excellent service and truly delicious selections.
data.title: SPITI SOU Restaurant is your home away from home

data.text: Lovely spot for a time out, away from all the buzz in the louvre. Located in the Richelieu Wing, we decided to give it a try for the famous eats. We had the signature hot chocolate and a few desserts of which were delicious. View from the restaurant is great too, overlooking the Louvre Pyramid!
data.title: Time out inside the Louvre

data.text:
This restaurant is a disaster of epic proportions.  We came to Acte II with my Parisian friend who had been here many times with excellent experiences. We knew something was off and should have left but didn't because we were with a group and knew it would be difficult to find another reservation so late.  Here is what occurred:
1. The waiter brought a menu that was NOT the menu displayed on the website and told us the bartender is not working and therefore we cannot order any cocktails.
2. We had to order 3 different bottles of wine before the waiter found one that was in stock.
3. The waiter told us the chef asked if we could wait until a larger group had been served to place our order.
4. After about an hour we were finally able to order
5. The chef came over and told us he ran out of shrimp because the larger group ate them all
6. The chicken brochette was brought to us completely undercooked (raw) and when we returned it, the chef rolled his eyes, and threw it back onto the grill with no apology, and also gave us the SAME, partially cut into skewer, rather than prepare a new one
7. When we got the bill it still had the charge for the shrimp that we never got because it ran out and no courtesy of any credit as an apology for al that had occurred that night.
8.  When my Parisian friend approached the chef on our exit and complained to him, he blew his cigarette in her face and said to her sarcastically ....  "Did you think this was a restaurant gastronomique?!"

Um, YES, actually, we did because this is how you present yourself on your website, This was seriously the most horrible, shameful dining experience I have ever had ANYWHERE,  The owners and chefs should hang their heads in shame, how dare they treat customers this way or think anything like this was acceptable.  You deserve to go out of business, DO NOT GO HERE.
data.title: HORRIBLE ... a complete EMBARRASSMENT

data.text:
If you happen to be around Bastille area and you are a Pizza Lover, then you shouldn‚Äôt miss this place! 

We went there by chance but will surely return! Pizza is to die for‚Ä¶.I took ‚ÄúBurrata verde‚Äù which I highly recommend! 
Waiting Staff were very nice & helpful! 
Opens for both Lunch & Dinner.

Enjoy & Buon Apetito üòã
data.title: Attention Pizza üçï Lovers!

data.text: One of the best pizzas in Paris. They are original and tasteful and they are served by lovely people. Definitely recommend!!
data.title: Lovely

data.text: We really enjoyed the visit, good service, reasonable prices, delicious snacks. The host was lovely, please give the place a chance
data.title: !worth a try

data.text: We stumbled across this absolute little gem purely because it was next to our hotel and we made a point of stopping by every evening of our trip. A brand new family run business with a stunning selection of wines and cocktails. Th signature cocktail created by Luigi," The Pantera Rosa" is to die for, my wife adored this. Can't recommend this place enough, style, quality, friendly staff and unbelievable value for money. This place would be our new regular if we lived here. Well done guys, we hope you have all of the wonderful success you deserve.
data.title: Must try!

data.text:
It is primarily a bakery. 
They have indoor and outdoor seating. 
You order your food, pay and either sit and eat or to go your food. 
The food is fresh and flavorful. 
They have baked goods, breakfast croissants, different types of the Roman breads, cookies, focaccia, pizza by the slice. They have a juice bar and you can get also a freshly squeezed orange juice. They have a tiny coffee bar on the far right corner, which is occasionally used by locals. There is a section where you choose from meal and lunch options to buy and take away. 
The prices are a little expensive, they often forget to issue the receipt. Always ask for it. 
It looks like very local compare to tourist areas.
Lots of inside and outside seating. 
Try it.
data.title: Good food, but a little expensive.

data.text:
Made a reservation on the day itself and got a seating for dinner service.  Location was just outside the historic centre and in a tucked away, grungy location. 

The staff were hospitable and spoke good english, presenting each individual dish and answering questions. 

My partner and I had the chef's tasting menu, which included meat, seafood and vegetarian items. There was a special promotion for an additional 3 complimentary courses which left us leaving full and satisfied. 

The dishes were inventive and fun, refined but not snobbish. Some were better than others but they overall rounded each other out and made for a fantastic overall experience. 

I had a glass of wine which while not fantastic, I will choose to overlook, as I would have gone for a bottle in hindsight as they looked to carry some great local natural wine options.

In summary: go here for a casual and non-stiff fine dining experience, the place is cozy, the staff are hospitable and most would find the dishes fun and agreeable. 

Look to spend an average of 70-80 euros per head for food and drink. Ciao!
data.title: Pleasant and well presented dining experience

data.text: This place is amazing!  Our family had the Chef‚Äôs 7 course tasting menu and it was delicious.  The food was artfully presented and tasted heavenly!  Each course was delightful and the service was very good as well.  We thoroughly enjoyed our evening at Cuoco and Camicia.  This was absolutely our best meal in Europe.  Wine pairing was nice also.
data.title: Delightful!

data.text: Found this restaurant by chance‚Ä¶ a week in Rome, eating well and this was the best dining experience we had by far. The belly pork and prawn starters were reimagined and out of this world!
data.title: Back Street Excellence!

data.text: Took tasting menu, chef's choice with wine package. 7 courses. Well, although it was an interesting experience, the food was not that great. Some of the courses were good, but some not. The wine was also good wines, but i did not get any special sensation of the combo with the food. The atmosphere was ok  and the servic was also ok. But this is what it is, just ok. And the price, a bit too high in my opinion taking the total expense into account.
data.title: This one is complicated

data.text: Absolutely fabulous restaurant. We had the eight course "sea" tasting menu, every dish was delicious and beautiful. We also had the wine pairings, this was four decent sized glasses of wine, each glass paired with two courses. The service was great, we felt really comfortable and the servers were attentive but not overbearing. Highly recommended for a special occasion.
data.title: Perfect, special little restaurant

data.text:
I was here with 4 friends we order 2 beefsteak an 2 fish with potatoes and  Salad.
The food was nice and the Price ok. Super staff thank.s we come back
data.title: Nice food  and Drinks

data.text:
I made the mistake of going there without reading the reviews.  AVOID this place , it‚Äôs a total rip off , Euro 46 for 2 poor pizzas a beer and a coke , the specials advertising board outside said it should have been Euro 10 each but the staff said it wasn‚Äôt down to them it was the system. It was only after the argument that I realised the bill didn‚Äôt even add up , they had further overcharged by Euro 6 just by not adding up correctly 

AVOID  AT ALL COSTS
data.title: I made the mistake of going

data.text: Way over priced for mediocre gelato. I should have checked the ratings before I set foot in this place.
data.title: Terrible!

data.text: DO NOT GO THERE!!!   There‚Äôs a reason no one is eating there! Ridiculous prices!  2 quarter chickens with rice or potato, one glass house wine and one beer were 72 euros!!!  We feel sorry for girl who‚Äôs job it is to get you to stop and eat there.
data.title: DO NOT GO THERE!!!   Horribly inflated prices!

data.text:
Warning do not go here!!!!  The board outside offers a great deal... once your in your trapped. You ask for a beer and you get a ‚Ç¨15 litre. Paid ‚Ç¨46 for 2 small panini‚Äôs 1 french fries and coke 
Lucky to escape at that!!!!!
data.title: Warning do not go here!!!!

data.text: After sitting down I read the reviews and was nervous but service was great, the food was good and we were happy with our visit!
data.title: Surprised & Satisfied!

data.text: The worst ice cream in Rome, it was 7 euros for 3 scopes in a waffle cone and it was bad ice cream compared to all the others we have had.
data.title: Terrible ice cream

data.text: Paid 6 euros for 2 small scoops of ice cream in a cup instead of a cone. The ice cream itself was still frozen
data.title: Go anywhere else

data.text: I had a bad feeling about this restaurant from the time I had contact with the waiter, who was unfriendly and made me feel unwelcome. I was uncomfortable the whole time and just felt that I was a target. I didn‚Äôt pick terrible as I was not threatened or the like, but the experience left a bad taste in my mouth. Avoid. If you do go, ask for the legal bill. Don‚Äôt accept the post it note the waiter may try and give at first. It‚Äôs a shame that these places exist, they don‚Äôt do Rome justice and should be embarrassed: it‚Äôs easy to be polite.
data.title: Avoid. Unfriendly and unwelcoming.

data.text: Had a very nice breakfast with coffee here one morning. Food was good, staff was very nice. Good place to start your day.
data.title: Breakfast

data.text: Just happened to stumble upon this place and had a beautiful meal.  Delicious fettuccine bolognese and spinach ravioli.!!  Great service as well.  Would definitely return.
data.title: Delicious Italian Food!

data.text:
We enjoyed a late lunch after our arrival to Rome. 
The food was excellent and the restaurant neat and nice. The restaurant was very nice and  looked newly renowated. Service was good and we enjoyed the ambiance very much. 
Thank you for a great time.
data.title: A great place for a great food experience

data.text:
Lovely authentic restaurant, the food was amazing. The service was friendly, fun and very welcoming. 
We sat at the tables in the street, great for watching the world go by.
Perfect.
Highly recommended
data.title: Eat Here if you are in Rome.  Superb food and great service

data.text: This is a fantastic restaurant. It is kid friendly and doesn‚Äôt feel in the least bit ‚Äútouristy‚Äù. A great and genuine modern Italian restaurant.
data.title: Great place

data.text: Excellent restaurant with a 5 star staff near the Colosseum in Rome.  The food was amazing from the antipasti, pastas, pizza, main dishes, and desserts .  We went here several times during our visit and were amazed every single time!  Fabio, Asia, Claudio, Claudia and the rest of the staff are top notch!  They took amazing care of our group and had great recommendations on wine too!
data.title: Amazing restaurant in Roma!

data.text: We ordered a set lunch which was beautifully presented. We‚Äôre glad we tried this as it was an experience but it wasn‚Äôt really our kind of food.
data.title: Beautifully Presented

data.text: After walked The Imperial Gardens the whole morning, I was tired and with the heavy rain, I was grateful and thankful to the waitress who was willing to accept my lunch order as it was exactly 2pm. The curry rice was delicious.
data.title: Delicious curry rice

data.text: I had been walking around the Kokyogaien Gardens for sometime and was glad to find the Resthouse. It had toilets, a restaurant, and tourist information (much about local walking areas). I settled on a vegetable curry at 980 yen, which came with bottomless drinks. The coffee was made and grinded fresh, but was just average. The curry had few vegetables, but did have rice and salad, so was reasonably priced overall.
data.title: Opens 08.30 hrs

data.text: We pre-ordered the 3-tier lunch box for 6 of us through our hotel. The food was ok. Not fantastic but considering the theme of the lunch set we understand that it is prepared in a certain way. For the experience, i would say we are paying 1836¬•/set for the traditional way of selection & preparation of the food & free flow of drinks. The service was far off from the usual welcoming feel of other restaurants in japan. We were told that the explanation of the food in the lunch box is in that booklet, which was fine. After making the payment for the meal, we needed some hot water to bring away in such cold weather so my husband went to fill up 1 flask of hot plain water fm their beverage section and he was told that he cannot "take-out" the water & must pour away the water in his flask. I dont understand the rational. We couldn't ask in detail the reason because the waitress doesn't speak much english. Conversation with the staffs were a pain. So he just pour away the hot water. While we were leaving, i was asked by their waiter "Did you pay?" I just say yes & walked off. I'm totally offended by such question as if 6 of us would go to an empty restaurant, eat for free & walk off scott-free? No welcome, no thank you. Worst restaurant i have ever been to.
data.title: Food is above average but service is way below average

data.text: Wonderful, learning experience, the Edo style 3 tiered box lunch, served with miso soup, tea, and dessert (coffee and dorayaki- pancake filled with bean paste).  There are other options to dine here, but the Edo lunch was very interesting, to be able to sample foods prepared in the Edo period, such as Edo style shrimp tempura, sakana no suzume-yaki, goshiki sengakuji ( grilled tofu with 5 different toppings), konnyaku no iridashi, and one layer of  rice topped with cooked chestnuts - all seasonal vegetables.  Make a reservation ahead, can get booked.
data.title: Edo eco cooking, 3-tiered box lunch

data.text: Happened upon this place just walking around and was very happy with my Wagyu sliced short rib. The rice was great, I enjoyed my veggies and the meat was amazing. The personal grill is a fun touch! It's a small place, only fits about 16 people and I paid about $228 HKD for the whole meal.
data.title: Wonderful and cozy

user_location.name: Colorado Springs, El Paso County, Colorado

data.text:
Stepping into this resto @rockwagyuhk , it brought me back to tokyo with its showa era style decor. We didn‚Äôt queue as we came to have late lunch at 3 pm on Sunday. 

We have ordered 2 appetisers, 2 sets of wagyu‚Äîgyukatsu and diced Wagyu, which came with miso soup, dipping sauces, salad, pickles and a bowl of rice.  We have upgraded the rice bowl with a raw egg yolk and seaweed‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èit was savoury and let you complete the whole bowl!

The wagyu was prepared to just above rare so you cooked each piece to your preferred temperature. We both chose to give our cuts on the hot stone to get it to medium. 

The meat was tender, beautifully marbled and unforgettable. I love my cutlet beef, the crispy breading on the outside to the tenderness of the meat was just phenomenal!

Another highlight must be the wagyu tartare! It was as soft as the fatty tuna sashimi. The egg yolk gave it the silky texture with the mild tangy tasted sauce. 

We finished our meal with their signature drink Fujiyama soda.  It was instagrammable, refreshing and not too sweet. 

The restaurant fits the atmosphere perfectly and if you're looking for a more authentic Japanese experience. It is definitely worth seeking out but preferably avoid rush hour.
data.title: Japanese A4 Wagyu individual grills!

data.text:
Cafe Joo is part of the Lubuds Restaurant Group. They opened up this casual and modern Korean restaurant on 1/F of the New Town Plaza shopping mall in Sha Tin earlier this year. Menu features dishes with Western influence so you have some traditional Korean cuisine along with pasta dishes and even a range of burgers.

There is a nice sized indoor seating section as well as some table outside which is quite rare in this part of Hong Kong. Opening hours are 11.30am to 10pm (weekdays) and 10am to 10pm (weekends). 

I had lunch here recently, menus are provided but you can use their wifi and online order app to look digital version of the menu and place orders. Service is friendly, my Wagyu w/ cheese burger combo was prepared and ready in less than 10 minutes. 

Food quality is better than you'd expect. The Wagyu burger was pretty good, reminded me that the old days of not being able to find a decent burger anywhere in the N.T. are long past. There are now burger specialists at New Town Plaza like Shake Shack and local outfit called Honbo and now Cafe Joo that grills up a nice quality burger topped with a fried pepper, fries, salad or soup and drink for lunch. 

Based on this experience, I'd be happy to take lunch at Cafe Joo. It is a good new restaurant at New Town Plaza.
data.title: Surprisingly good burger at Cafe Joo in Sha Tin

data.text: Very tradition nostalgia Cantonese food in a elegant setting although the space in between tables is quite close for a place like this. We loved every dishes as it was all executed well. Definitely will be back for more....
data.title: Convenience located in Central and price is very reasonable for good quality Cantonese food.

data.text: An elegant restaurant serving good nostalgia dim sum. The pigeon is fried to perfection and all the dim sum that we ordered was definitely taste good and eye appealing. Service is also attentive. It would of been one of the best yum Cha restaurant if it had a better view but nonetheless we look forward to go back again.
data.title: High standard nostalgia dim sum restaurant

data.text:
I‚Äôve been dining there many times with my husband for over 2 years. They‚Äôve never failed us on all kinds of food we ordered. See below our ranking ^ ^

5 STARS
Oyster

4 STARS
Pasta, Risotto & Lamb

Their pizza and wine is very good too.
data.title: Highly Recommended : P

data.text: Never would have thought we could get such good quality steak and oysters in the middle of Jordan! You can tell that great effort was put into the cooking process. Even the vegetables on the side were well cooked and not greasy - there sweet potato mash was a nice touch as opposed to the standard mash you always get given in other places. Price was reasonable. The place looks a little tired but all compensated by the great service and their helpful staff. Will definitely visit again.
data.title: Hidden gem

data.text:
First of all I have to say that from the first experience when I was there I felt that they are doing the real Italian food there.
Also you can find some other type food from the menu. Lunch time it‚Äôs very worth of the money to have lunch there. Service is very good and they are very professional in Italian ingredients as well.  They have own Italian food grocery in downstairs, very good one. They have real Italian Chef there, if call Italian Marco, the Chef,  and he is ready to do some adjustments i.e. you have some special wish about toppings on your pizza. I really recommend this nice atmosphere ristorante. They have great wine list as well.
data.title: Italian & Steak

data.text:
We loved the Pepperoni Pizza we ordered at this restaurant.  It's like a combination of Four Cheese and regular Pepperoni in one pizza.  However, their Mushroom soup needs to be a little less creamy.  Iced tea is a little tangy but lemony sweet.

Breakfast served is quite okay.  I loved best the choice of bacon and 2 eggs.  I love how they cook their bacons. Best with toast or rice.  I just took a taste of their congee but still finished it.  It's different from the congee I used to take in Manila.
data.title: Best Pizza

data.text:
Visited for lunch , looked a good value menu ... however the cream of mushroom soup should have been called cream if garlic and it was raw garlic rather than delicate.
Had tenderloin with vegetables and potatoes. 
A diced olive a single cherry tomatoes and a few green weed things don't count as vegetables in my book.
The tenderloin was anything but tender. Good portion but I left more than half.
The chicken curry and pork chop looked lovely. I guess so did mine . It's in the taste rather than the look.
the steps up from the lobby could do with a good clean too.
Poor show on what looked to be great.
data.title: The chef needs to taste his produce and learn to season

data.text: Having tried the fresh and delicious italian food in tivoli food hall, we wanted to try this newly opened restaurant run by the same owner. We ordered the 5 course menu and it was a fantastic experience. Everything was homemade dishes from the toscana region where the owner is also from. We highly recommend trying this place(& the homemade foccacia), we think it is the best italian restaurant in copenhagen :).
data.title: Fantastic authentic italian experience!

data.text: From the second you enter you feel welcome. We had a wonderful panini, great coffee and superb service. And we will come back for more!
data.title: Super nice in all ways

data.text: What a lovely place. Really nice service and good and tasty Italian food. I had a really nice evening sitting in the bar, and the chefs were very talkative and informative.
data.title: Very nice experience

data.text: Must visit this place for great Italian food, simple and well presented food with a menu simple enough to ensure good quality. Worth a visit.
data.title: Bit of a gem in this area

data.text: Looking for somewhere to eat on our first night in Copenhagen and chanced upon Pirlo (it's tucked away).  Staff were welcoming and friendly.  The food was good and the atmosphere was lively.  It was very busy, so obviously popular with locals.
data.title: Good food; good service; good ambience.

data.text: Right up front this place was excellent.  One person said best steak they have ever had.   It is a nice restaurant, but not so formal that you need to dress up.   They have a Chinese restaurant inspired steak house theme.   They have dumpling and noodle appetizers.  The dumplings have diner style fillings in some of them, like pastrami or Reuben.  We had the crispy pork dumplings and they were delicious.   We also had an excellent Caesars salad.   The steaks were the star of the show.   They were thick and perfectly cooked.   They have a crispy filet mignon, which is battered and served with a dipping sauce.  It was pretty good, but just the steak was probably a better option.  The steaks were pretty big 12 oz, so come hungry or share.   They have some that are meant to be shared that are 20+ ounces, which we did not try.   We had mashed potatoes as a side and they were good but I would choose something else next time.   Martinis were good.   Ok wine list.   Nice service.  Super nice door man.   It‚Äôs not cheap, but for a nice occasion it‚Äôs worth it.
data.title: Unique spin in steak house

data.text:
This place is AMAZING!! The food is Delicious!
Staff great! I will definitely be back! Must try the Bass and the garlic broccoli
data.title: Great Food &Good Vibez!

data.text: Visited for a friend‚Äôs birthday and we were late but they still honored our reservation. The restaurant has beautiful ambience. My meal was A+. All of the staff was extremely nice especially our server Sanja. She was very attentive and even took pictures for us. Amazing, will be returning.
data.title: Amazed

data.text: Very nice ambience. Server was great and service was timed well. We shared lamb dumplings for appetizer very good. Our side was shrimp fried rice which was outstanding and quantity was more than enough. I had the filet which was good but not over the top. My wife had chicken wraps. It came with half iceberg lettuce head and pasta dish full of stuffing. My wife did not really enjoy it. She was hoping for chicken and not ground chicken. No dessert.
data.title: Not bad

data.text: We had a great meal at Brooklyn Chop House in Times Square. We had many appetizers, and we shared main courses and desserts. Raheim was our waiter and he was fun, friendly, efficient, and honest about portions and how much we should order. The rest of the staff was terrific as well. We will definitely be back.
data.title: Interesting food and terrific staff

data.text: I was staying down the street and went there every morning, on the second day the employees remembered my name., Everyone was great. Theron (SP?) was super friendly and great to chat with. The coffee was delicious and the everything cream cheese croissant  was heavenly,
data.title: amazing coffee, amazing employees

data.text: Really nice coffee by the Brooklyn bridge. Other famous coffee place on the Main Street, but walk a few minutes extra to this gem. Smooth espresso, good service, and the toilets are nice and clean.
data.title: Great coffee

data.text:
We were wandering on streets of Manhattan and badly needed a mouthful of hot drinks. I was fortunate we found this place. Even in Sunday morning they had plenty of customers, that was a good sign for me.

This caf√© was rather small and all tables were occupied. But fortunately while we were ordering beverages, one of tables became vacant.

And like I wrote above, that was the best ‚Äúcafe au lait‚Äù I tasted! Even in Paris I didn‚Äôt drink such delicious coffee.
data.title: The best ‚Äúcafe au lait‚Äù

user_location.name: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Volga District

data.text: Recently stayed in the area and though there were chain coffee joints nearby I wanted to try something new.  I found Birch Coffee and ordered a mocha.  It was delicious and I found a stool by the window to watch the world go by while I drank my coffee.  It is near Pace University so there were a lot of young people around and it has a simple and useful decor.
data.title: great mocha

data.text:
Came here early before a food tour. The coffee is out of this world. So delicious.
Would highly recommend.
data.title: Amazing coffee

data.text: The lunch and food quality are just great. Excellent setting in quiet part of Wall Street. Unfortunately, the waiter showed zero point zero interest in our table. He was even on hist TikTok accont, with the sound all the way up. Absolutely not OK...
data.title: Food top, service should improve

data.text: The staff and food at top notch.  We are FiDi locals and big foodies and feel lucky to have this new addition to the neighborhood.  The staff really goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome.  The Greek food is some of the best we have had and the cocktails are also delicious!
data.title: 5 Star Service + Food!

data.text: After a long day of sightseeing and walking for miles through NYC, we ended our day at the 911 memorials and Wall Street. Fortunately, we found a delicious restaurant nearby that was open for either a late lunch or early dinner. My daughter loved the Mediterranean esthetic of the restaurant, and the hostess gave us both a lunch and dinner menu since it was around 4 p.m. Our party of 4 started with the Pikilia which had tzatziki, hummus, eggplant, and olives on a lazy susan. Our server even provided us with additional complimentary pita. I ordered the charred octopus as an entree while the others in our party enjoyed the lobster pasta which was a generous portion of both lobster and pasta, the asparagus linguini, and a side of roasted artichokes. The Spanakopita was full of spinach and cheese. We were too stuffed for dessert!
data.title: Opa!

data.text: This was hands down one of the best meals I have ever had! service is amazing, food is to die for , will be back
data.title: Simply the best

data.text: My family and I were visiting the city and made reservations here. The staff were very accommodating and had our table ready a few minutes prior to our reservation. The customer service is excellent, as is the food. We had bottomless mimosas and sangria‚Äîboth were great! The owner conversed with us to be sure we had a great experience. I highly recommend Pig and Butter and will be sure to stop by for brunch every time I'm in town.
data.title: good food

data.text:
Very tiny all day brunch spot on the lower east side.  It has three tables in the back, extremely close together, and a few bar stools right inside the door.  They also have an outdoor table.  It‚Äôs not the most comfortable place I‚Äôve ever been, but the staff has the most heart I‚Äôve ever seen!

I had the Mexican chorizo scramble, which was chorizo, an unconventional savory, crispy cornbread, chipotle crema, pickled red onions, negro mole, charred pineapple salsa, and fried egg.

Creative, tasty dish, though maybe the meat was a little dry.

I also had their smoky Mary, made with sake, tomatillo, deviled egg, capers, candied bacon, and more.

This restaurant also has a selection of French toast, fried chicken and waffles, omelets, and burgers.

As I mentioned, the staff has heart.  It was just one server doing everything and one cook.  Everything was wonderful, but please be understanding of staffing and space.  If you can‚Äôt be, skip this one.
data.title: Unique brunch takes in small space
